claims.claim: Perseverance and visibility after incarceration can lead to unexpected opportunities.
claims.quote: Once I came home, I used that stubbornness to my advantage and I just kept showing up. [...] This job actually came to me.

claims.claim: It's important to stay engaged with the issues related to incarceration for advocacy and personal growth.
claims.quote: I believe that I'm meant to be a voice, and so I need to stay close to these things.

claims.claim: Being proactive and seizing opportunities despite doubts can lead to success in reentry.
claims.quote: And I said, let them tell me no because they're the only ones that can tell me no.

claims.claim: Community involvement and volunteering can result in job opportunities for returning citizens.
claims.quote: I had been visible enough with work with places like Nation Outside and Home of New Vision and just volunteering [...] the person who started this organization knew of me, thought that I was a good fit.

claims.claim: Support from individuals within community organizations can propel returning citizens into impactful roles.
claims.quote: he called up my supervisor at Home of New Vision and he said, do you think Adam is up for this job?  My supervisor said Adam was built for this job.

claims.claim: Returning citizens can significantly contribute to the growth of organizations when given a chance.
claims.quote: 18 months later, we've quadrupled our staff, quadrupled our budgets and everybody's asking us what our secret sauce is.
